page.title: 17CHANGES IN STEWARTBY
page.content: council, as in any other community, instead of the company. The companys view was that in the past the problem was being seen to be helpful, but not interfering. It had always been a difficult line to draw and occasionally they had overstepped the mark. 4. {The Future It is inevitable that any big change such as that in Stewartby was bound to cause controversy. Only time will tell what the future holds for Stewartby. The Hanson Trust was reassuring in its attitude towards the village and its future, believing the village would now be in the hands of the new homeowners with the attendant responsibilities. However amongst the residents the attitude was more reserved, especially among the elder residents who saw the break up of the
